# It's official. Deel is now a U-N-I-C-O-R-N

Deel news

Image

Author

Deel Team

Last Update

April 30, 2025

These past 12 months have been an incredible ride. Today we're happy to share with the world (and especially you reading this) that we've raised our Series C of $156 million, bringing Deel's valuation to $1.25 billion. We've officially entered unicorn territory, captain 🦄 [...] Led by YC Continuity, we raised our Series C of $156 million and welcomed Ali Rowghani, Managing Partner of YC Continuity, to our board. The round was co-led by two of our incredible existing investors, Andreessen Horowitz and Spark Capital. That brings our total funding to over $200 million, all within a year. This would in no way have been possible without the help of Shuo, Dan, Yaron, Philippe, our board, the Deel team, and our amazing customers and partners. While we take the time to bask [...] ## The best is on the way

It’s a cause for celebration; however, the journey has just begun. Armed with our Deel Speed ⚡️, agile team, and ability to adapt, we’ve been able to quickly become the best. We’re excited about what the future holds and how we can grow by focusing on some key areas with this additional funding.

## Making our global footprint even bigger

raw_exit_results.title: HR Tech Is White Hot: Is Every Vendor Now A Unicorn? - Josh Bersin
raw_exit_results.content:
The HR Tech market is as hot as I’ve ever seen it, with most of the funding announcements showing $ Billion valuations. As I like to tell my neighbors, a Billion Dollars ain’t what it used to be. But it’s still a lot of money. [...] Lattice, a performance management platform that mid-sized companies love, is now valued at $1 Billion (the first PM company to do this since SuccessFactors was acquired by SAP), creating interest in vendors like 15Five, Workboard, Betterworks, and TinyPulse. CultureAmp, another pioneer in this space, could be close to this kind of valuation. And TinyPulse, one of the pioneers in mid-market performance and engagement, was just acquired by Limeade, again showing market opportunity. [...] Eightfold.ai, the leader in AI-enabled talent intelligence, is valued at well over $1 Billion and just received $300M. This is a company that has disrupted recruiting in a big way and has the potential to take over a lot of other HR technology segments, built around its advanced AI-enabled platform.

Visier, the pioneer and leader in People Analytics, just raised $125 M with a $1 Billion valuation.

raw_exit_results.title: The future of human capital in M&A: Why HR is key to success.
raw_exit_results.content: Mergers and acquisitions (M&A) typically begin with numbers: scaling up, expanding market reach, integrating value chain or boosting revenue. However, data suggests that around 70% of M&A deals fail to achieve their expected value creation objectives. The reasons? Unclear strategic objectives, overpricing, underestimation of integration importance, you name it. [...] HR plays a critical role in managing workforce transitions across different types of M&A transactions. In asset deals, the Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) (TUPE1) regulation provides a structured framework to preserve employee rights. However, TUPE is not the only mechanism for employee transfers. Depending on the type of M&A deal, companies may also explore: [...] Once the deal closes, integration is the ultimate test. Over 60% of failed M&A deals cite integration issues as a primary reason, according to Forbes, and Financier Worldwide. HR’s role is to build cohesion and clarity. From townhall to facilitating team-building initiatives to bridge gaps between employees from both organizations, HR must be the link between the organizations during this intense discovery period between the employees.

raw_exit_results.title: Revenue Multiples by Industry (2025) - Eqvista
raw_exit_results.content:
A reliable revenue multiple is derived by considering the selling priceandannual revenues of comparable public companies in the industry. The wider the batch of reference companies, the better the credibility. Here is a standard revenue multiple formula:

Revenue multiple = Selling price of company / Annual Revenue

Let’s explore this with a simple example. Here are five public companies from a particular industry and their revenue multiples derived from the above formula. [...] One must remember that revenue multiple valuations by industry are only a baseline. It is not an actual value. Since there is no other reliable way to assess the value of a startup in the initial stages of the business cycle, revenue multiples provide a guideline. Here are some reference points: [...] This is a more wholesome ratio when compared to the price-to-sales ratio. This considers the value of a firm to be a combination of debt and equity. The revenue multiple formula, in this case, looks like:

Revenue multiple = Market value of equity + Market value of debt - Cash / Gross revenue

raw_exit_results.title: 32 IPO Candidates for 2025 - RepVue
raw_exit_results.content:
RepVue

###### Notifications

RepVue

# Ultimate Sales Career Blog

# 32 IPO Candidates for 2025

RepVue Team

The last couple of years have been quiet for IPOs. Collapsing revenue multiples, rising interest rates, and an unpredictable economy made it hard for companies to go public. Many promising tech companies chose to wait it out, leading to some of the slowest years for IPOs in recent memory. In fact, 2023 and 2024 saw some of the lowest IPO activity in over a decade. [...] But 2025 could be different. With falling interest rates, and market sentiment improving, many of the tech darlings that stayed private are now rumored to be preparing for a public offering. Dozens of tech companies that have been growing behind the scenes might make their public debut. [...] A potential IPO should be exciting for the salespeople at these companies, too. Reps might see financial rewards if they hold options or shares. And going public can boost a company’s reputation and widen its reach, making it easier to attract new clients and close bigger deals.

From AI pioneers to fintech disruptors, these companies are positioning themselves to capitalize on renewed investor confidence and a tech-hungry market.

## Top IPO Candidates for 2025

   Sector: AI startups are commanding premium valuations, while hardware or biotech companies typically take longer to catch up.

SMB-focused HR tech with moderate growth

fragmentation.explanation: Market has traditional incumbents for domestic payroll but is relatively new for global EOR services. Several well-funded startups are competing for market share in the remote work/global employment space.

market_landscape.market_size: $50B+ for global EOR and international payroll services (2023)
barriers_to_entry: Complex regulatory compliance across multiple countries
Need for extensive global legal and tax expertise
Required local entity network and partnerships
Significant capital requirements for global infrastructure
Trust and reputation in handling sensitive payroll data

outlier_analysis.outlier_reasoning: Deel demonstrates strong outlier characteristics primarily due to its exceptional growth rate (100%) compared to both market growth (25-30% CAGR) and public comparables (17-25% growth). They've pioneered a comprehensive global EOR and payroll solution at a time when remote work and global hiring have become critical business needs. Their revenue scale ($500M) and growth rate suggest superior execution in a complex market with significant barriers to entry. Their timing with the global remote work surge and continuing international hiring trends is particularly advantageous.
key_outlier_factors: 4x higher growth rate than market average
First-mover advantage in integrated global EOR/payroll
Exceptional market timing with remote work trends
Strong revenue scale in complex market
High barriers to entry protecting market position
risk_factors: Increasing competition from well-funded players like Remote and Papaya Global
Potential market slowdown in global hiring
High customer acquisition costs in enterprise segment
outlier_analysis.valuation_insight: Given Deel's 100% growth rate vs public comp median of ~20%, and considering the strategic value of their global infrastructure, a premium multiple of 12-15x revenue would be justified (vs public median of 7.9x). Strategic acquirers like Microsoft or Salesforce might value even higher given synergies and market position.
